snippet: The Row added pops of color to its predominantly neutral palette for prefall.
abstract: The Row added pops of color to its predominantly neutral palette for prefall.
lead_paragraph: The Row, known for sticking to a predominantly neutral palette (black, gray, navy; spring 2012 was all white), added pops of two lively new colors - maroon and blush pink - to its repertory for prefall. True to the brand's ethos, the collection was stocked with exquisitely tailored, wearable separates: leather jackets, T-shirts and skirts; cozy turtleneck sweaters; and crisp button-down shirts. Wow factor arrived in the form of alligator bags (new shapes include a flat shopper and a bucket, shown here), fox fur scarves and graphic fox fur coats, like this one.
